intro: Galium constrictum var. rhiphaeum, commonly known as narrowleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, narrow ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its medicinal properties have been historically noted for their mild diuretic and antiseptic effects.
